intro: Galium dregeanum, commonly known as the dwarf chainflower, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium dregeanum is adapted to sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions.
